briefdescription.para: Special value to select all columns from manifest files.
Field IDs that uniquely identify rows in the table.
Mapping from field id to field.
Mapping from field name to field id.
Mapping from lowercased field name to field id.
Mapping from field id to (nested) position path to access the field.
Highest field ID in the schema.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< SchemaField > fields, std::optional< int32_t > schema_id=std::nullopt, std::vector< int32_t > identifier_field_ids={})
memberdef.name: Schema

briefdescription.para: Get the schema ID.

detaileddescription.para: A schema is identified by a unique ID for the purposes of schema evolution.

briefdescription.para: Get a user-readable string representation.

memberdef.definition: Result< std::optional< std::reference_wrapper< const SchemaField > > > iceberg::Schema::FindFieldByName
memberdef.name: FindFieldByName

briefdescription.para: Recursively find the SchemaField by field name.

detaileddescription.para: Short names for maps and lists are included for any name that does not conflict with a canonical name. For example, a list, 'l', of structs with field 'x' will produce short name 'l.x' in addition to canonical name 'l.element.x'. A map 'm', if its value include a structs with field 'x' wil produce short name 'm.x' in addition to canonical name 'm.value.x'. FIXME: Currently only handles ASCII lowercase conversion; extend to support non-ASCII characters (e.g., using std::towlower or ICU)

memberdef.definition: Result< std::optional< std::reference_wrapper< const SchemaField > > > iceberg::Schema::FindFieldById
memberdef.name: FindFieldById

briefdescription.para: Recursively find the SchemaField by field id.

parameterdescription.para: The id of the field to get the accessor for.

simplesect.para: The field with the given id, or std::nullopt if not found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the canonical field name for the given id.

parameterdescription.para: The id of the field to get the canonical name for.

simplesect.para: The canocinal column name of the field with the given id, or std::nullopt if not found.

briefdescription.para: Get the accessor to access the field by field id.

parameterdescription.para: The id of the field to get the accessor for.

simplesect.para: The accessor to access the field, or NotFound if the field is not found.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::span< const std::string > names, bool case_sensitive=true) const
memberdef.name: Select

briefdescription.para: Creates a projected schema from selected field names.

parameterdescription.para: Selected field names and nested names are dot-concatenated.
Whether name matching is case-sensitive (default: true).

simplesect.para: Projected schema containing only selected fields.
If the field name of a nested type has been selected, all of its sub-fields will be selected.

briefdescription.para: Creates a projected schema from selected field IDs.

parameterdescription.para: Set of field IDs to select

simplesect.para: Projected schema containing only the specified fields.
Field ID of a nested field may not be projected unless at least one of its sub-fields has been projected.

briefdescription.para: Return the field IDs of the identifier fields.
Return the canonical field names of the identifier fields.
Get the highest field ID in the schema.
Checks whether this schema is equivalent to another schema while ignoring the schema id.
Validate the schema for a given format version.

detaileddescription.para: This validates that the schema does not contain types that were released in later format versions.

parameterdescription.para: The format version to validate against.

simplesect.para: Error status if the schema is invalid.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< SchemaField > fields, std::optional< int32_t > schema_id=std::nullopt, const std::vector< std::string > &identifier_field_names={})
memberdef.name: Make

briefdescription.para: Create a schema.

parameterdescription.para: The fields that make up the schema.
The unique identifier for this schema (default: kInitialSchemaId).
Canonical names of fields that uniquely identify rows in the table (default: empty).

simplesect.para: A new Schema instance or Status if failed.

briefdescription.para: Compare two schemas for equality.

memberdef.type: Result< std::unordered_map< int32_t, std::reference_wrapper< const SchemaField > > >

memberdef.name: InitIdToFieldMap

memberdef.type: Result< std::unordered_map< std::string, int32_t, StringHash, std::equal_to<> > >

memberdef.name: InitIdToPositionPath

briefdescription.para: A schema for a Table.

detaileddescription.para: A schema is a list of typed columns, along with a unique integer ID. A Table may have different schemas over its lifetime due to schema evolution.
